data.title: Apple, Google hit setback in developing contact-tracing technology
data.text: CNBC's Deirdre Bosa on Apple and Google seeing a setback in the development of contact-tracing technology.

data.title: Apple and Google release phone app to notify users of coronavirus exposure
data.text: Technology will detect when an app user has spent time near another app user who later tests positive for the virus

data.title: FAANG emerges as the latest group to lead the market, Jim Cramer says
data.text: "This market's been going through leadership groups like there's no tomorrow," the "Mad Money" host said.

data.title: Stocks Rebound: ASML Breaks Out, Google, Splunk Near Buy Points
data.text: Stocks rebound: ASML breaks out; Google, Splunk near buy points.

data.title: Alabama, North Dakota And South Carolina To Debut Apple And Google’s Covid-19 Contact Tracing
data.text: The app will give users a notification when they have been near someone who has been infected with the coronavirus.

data.title: Apple, Google debut COVID-19 smartphone technology
data.text: Apple and Google on Wednesday released long-awaited smartphone technology to automatically notify people if they might have been exposed to the coronavirus. The companies said 22 countries and several US states are already planning to build voluntary phone apps using their software.

data.title: Apple, Google roll out coronavirus contact tracing software
data.text: FOX Business' Susan Li on Apple and Google's new contact tracing technology.

data.title: Google and Apple launch coronavirus contact-tracing software
data.text: Google and Apple have launched their coronavirus contact-tracing system on smartphones around the world.

data.title: Three states will use Apple-Google contact tracing technology for virus tracking apps
data.text: North Dakota, Alabama, and South Carolina are the first U.S. states to commit publicly to Apple and Google.

data.title: Apple and Google launch exposure notification API, enabling public health authorities to release apps
data.text: Apple and Google today made available the first public version of their exposure notification API, which was originally debuted as a joint-contact tracing software tool. The partners later renamed it the Exposure Notification system to more accurately reflect its functionality, which is designed to notify individuals of potential exposure to others who have confirmed cases […]

data.title: Google Cloud earns defense contract win for Anthos multi-cloud management tool
data.text: Google dropped out of the Pentagon’s JEDI cloud contract battle fairly early in the game, citing it was in conflict with its “AI principals.” However, today the company announced a new 7 figure contract with DoD’s Defense Innovation Unit (DIU), a big win for the cloud unit and CEO Thomas Kurian.

data.title: 7 Tech Stocks That Are Bolstered by Contact Tracing Initiatives
data.text: Many countries are using contact tracing to mitigate the spread of Covid-19 in a pre-vaccine world. These tech stocks are leading the way.

data.title: Google's cloud division lands deal with the Department of Defense
data.text: The deal is in the seven figure range, Axios reported ahead of the release.

data.title: Google plans to stop making A.I. tools for oil and gas firms
data.text: Google has pledged to stop making customized A.I software for firms who profit off fossil fuels.

data.title: Why Google Is Investing In Taiwan’s Tech Talent
data.text: Google is eyeing Taiwan again to help train more tech talent, with an eye toward advancing some of its digital tools and hiring trainees.
